title: What DLL is WinDbg's dt command implemented in?
content:
I know that most of the WinDbg extensions that are used with the exclamation mark, like !time , etc. are implemented inside the kdext.dll that are in: 

"C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Microsoft.WinDbg_1.2402.24001.0_x64__8wekyb3d8bbwe\amd64\winxp"

folder for the new WinDbg.

But where is the implementation of commands without the exclamation mark?

In my case I am interest about the dt command.

comments.text: (replying in comment because it's a guess): dt is in dbghelp.dll which also exports functions like SymGetTypeFromName and SymGetTypeInfo . See also stackoverflow.com/questions/3092609/â€¦

@Remko hmm, interesting. Thanks. I was thinking it's in dbgeng.dll . I was actually trying to see how they implemented it. Can't seem to find any symbols for it, not even something in it to place a breakpoint on.

ftr, dbgeng!ProcessCommands is where windbg parses input for its commands. you can use the help for each command (like dt -? ), as a good anchor point to locate the function responsible for its implementation.
@AliRizvi-Santiago: thanks, I'll check. Just from curiosity, where did you get the symbols for the dbgeng from?

ah, weird. symbols for 10.0.25324.1001 (both 7423359078CFAAAD2123C34621B4EBD71 and 314DA9A27F9A8D5B8088A2E1FD518B831) 404 on msdl.microsoft.com. however, i have 7423359078CFAAAD2123C34621B4EBD71, and EFBB90B73FCE200AB2D6B1E98F4425E31 (unsure of the version) cached.
